# lowercasing, removing punctuation, splitting into words
    text = text.lower()
    text = re.sub(r'[^\w\s]', '', text)
    words = re.split(r'\s+', text)

    # Counting words and finding the most common 10
    word_counts = Counter(words)
    most_common_words = word_counts.most_common(10)

    # Plotting the bar chart
    words, counts = zip(*most_common_words)
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
    ax.bar(words, counts)
    ax.set_xlabel('Words')
    ax.set_ylabel('Count')
    ax.set_title('Top 10 Most Common Words in Text')
    ax.set_xticklabels(words, rotation=45)
    plt.tight_layout()

    return most_common_words, ax

# Remove punctuation and lowercase text
    text = re.sub(r'[^\w\s]', '', text.lower())

    # Split text into words
    words = text.split()

    # Count the frequency of words
    word_counts = Counter(words)

    # Get the 10 most common words
    common_words = word_counts.most_common(10)

    # Plot the top 10 most common words
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    ax.bar([w[0] for w in common_words], [w[1] for w in common_words])
    ax.set_xticklabels([w[0] for w in common_words], rotation=45)
    ax.set_title("Top 10 most common words")
    return common_words, ax

# Remove punctuation and convert to lowercase
    text = re.sub(r'[^\w\s]', '', text).lower()
    # Split into words
    words = text.split()
    # Count word frequencies
    word_count = Counter(words)
    # Sort by count and get the top 10 words
    top_words = word_count.most_common(10)

    # Create a bar chart of the top 10 words
    labels, frequencies = zip(*top_words)
    ax = plt.bar(labels, frequencies)

    plt.xlabel('Words')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('Top 10 Common Words')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.show()
    return top_words, ax

# Remove all symbols except whitespace and words

    # Split text by words and convert to list

    # Count words

    # Get most common 10 words with their counts

    ax.set_title('Top 10 Most Common Words')

    # Display the plot

text = re.sub(r"[^\w\s]", "", text).lower()
    word_list = text.split()
    word_counts = Counter(word_list)
    common_words = word_counts.most_common(10)

    words = [word for word, _ in common_words]
    counts = [count for _, count in common_words]

    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    ax.bar(words, counts)
    ax.set_xlabel('Words')
    ax.set_ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.subplots_adjust(bottom=0.2)  # Adjust the bottom margin to accommodate rotated x-axis labels

    return common_words, ax

# Remove punctuation marks, lowercase the text, split it into words, and count the word frequency
    words = re.findall(r'\b\w+\b', text.lower())
    word_counts = Counter(words)

    # Get the top 10 most common words along with their counts
    top_common = word_counts.most_common(10)

    # Extract the words and counts from the tuples
    words, counts = zip(*top_common)

    # Plot the bar chart
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    ax.bar(words, counts)
    ax.set_xlabel('Words')
    ax.set_ylabel('Count')
    ax.set_title('Top 10 Most Common Words')
    ax.set_xticklabels(words, rotation=45)

    return top_common, ax

# Replace non-alphanumeric characters with whitespaces and lowercase text
    text = re.sub(r"\W+", " ", text).lower()
    # Split text into words
    words = text.split()
    # Count word frequency using Counter
    word_freq = Counter(words)
    # Get the 10 most common words
    top_10 = word_freq.most_common(10)
    # Create a bar chart for the top 10 words
    x, y = zip(*top_10)
    ax = plt.bar(x, y)
    # Show the plot
    plt.show()
    return top_10, ax

    word_count = Counter(words)

    # Get the top 10 most common words and their counts
    most_common_words = word_count.most_common(10)

    # Get the words and their counts for plotting
    words = [word for word, _ in most_common_words]

    ax.set_xticklabels(words, rotation=45)

# Remove punctuation, convert to lowercase, and split into words

    word_counts = Counter(text)

# Lowercase the text, remove punctuation, and split into words
    text = re.sub('[^\w\s]', '', text.lower())
    words = re.split(r'\s+', text)

    # Count the frequency of words
    word_counts = Counter(words)

    # Sort the words by frequency and get the top 10
    top_words = word_counts.most_common(10)

    # Plot the bar chart
    plt.style.use('ggplot')

    ax.bar(range(len(top_words)), [word[1] for word in top_words])
    ax.set_title('Top 10 Most Common Words')
    ax.set_xticks(range(len(top_words)))
    ax.set_xticklabels([word[0] for word in top_words])
    ax.set_xlabel('Word')
    ax.set_ylabel('Count')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45, ha='right')

    word_freq = Counter(words)

    # Sort the most common words
    most_common = word_freq.most_common(10)

# Replace all non-word characters with a space
